description: eight gods in the clouds, accompanied by two putti with ribbons; four gods are standing, four are seated; nine muses seated below on a hill with musical instruments, books, scepters and crowns
inscription:
Inscription

UC, above head of standing female figure (?Minerva), in pen and brown ink: illegible [ ? / spicchi]
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk heightened with white, on prepared brown paper
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, Florence, as by Giovanni da San Giovanni, to Scarpa; [Pietro Scarpa, Venice, until 1978; sold as by Giovanni da San Giovanni, for $1,560, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1978-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: The Olympian Gods and the Nine Muses
